Wow!  The ANN is complicated and large!  But I think
that's necessary.  Darren has solved a problem of the
type requiring active use of memory, after the weights
are fixed.  The problem of pattern recognition by
looking at only part of the pattern, and then
scanning, requires remembering what was seen.  This
may be the most difficult problem of this nature that
has been solved.  So, I am impressed.

The picture is too complex for me to interpret.  I
would like to know how many recurrent connections
there are, how many total weights & biases, and how
many neurons.  

I might try to do this with one of my recurrent binary nets.

=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
